info.description: Implements the Mailio server based on https://mirs.mail.io/ specifications
info.title: Mailio Server API

get.description: Retruns a list of VCs by mailio address
get.summary: List all VCs for a specific mailio address

get.description: Returns a single verifiable credential by id

post.description: Checks if signature is valid and returns a boolean object

parameters.description: Reference ID (request ID, could be anything)
parameters.name: requestId

post.description: Send end-to-end encrypted message to DID recipients
post.summary: Send end-to-end encrypted message to DID recipients

401.description: invalid signature or unauthorized to send messages

get.description: Returns a list of all supported domains

get.summary: Find user by base64 scrypt email address

parameters.description: Base64 formatted Scrypt of email address
parameters.name: email

get.description: Returns a single handshake by id

post.description: Request handshake from origin server (digitally signed)
post.summary: Request handshake from origin server (digitally signed) if missing in local database

403.description: Failed to login (valid signature, no valid VC)

post.description: Request handshake from this server (must be digitally signed)
post.summary: Request handshake from this server (must be digitally signed)

post.description: Receive end-to-end encrypted message (signed by senders Mailio server)
post.summary: Receive end-to-end encrypted message (signed by senders Mailio server)

get.description: Returns a nonce which client needs to sign with their private key
Identify if an email is a DIDcomm/Mailio or SMTP address, and resolve the DID if itâ€™s from a Mailio server.
get.summary: Resolve domain from email address (smtp or mailio)

invalid signature or unauthorized to send messages

get.description: Get logged in users basic information
Get logged in users smartkey based on a JWS token

post.summary: WebAuthnVerifyRegistration check the validity of the registration

get.description: Returns users DID document based on mailio address

code.description: Code is the HTTP status code

userPermissions.description: optional list of permissions specific to a target application

bcc.description: The email addresses of the BCC recipients.

bodyHTMLWithoutUnsafeTags.description: The HTML version of the email with removed unsafe tags

bodyHtml.description: The HTML version of the email.

bodyInlinePart.description: The raw inline content of the email.

bodyText.description: The text version of the email.

cc.description: The email addresses of the CC recipients.

from.description: The email address of the original sender.

headers.description: The email headers. (one header can be specified multiple times with different values)

replyTo.description: The email address to which bounces (undeliverable notifications) are to be forwarded.

sizeAttachmentsBytes.description: The size of the attachments in bytes.

sizeBytes.description: The size of the email in bytes.

sizeHtmlBodyBytes.description: The size of the HTML body in bytes.

sizeInlineBytes.description: The size of the inline content in bytes.

to.description: The email addresses of the recipients.

content.description: The raw content of the email.

contentDisposition.description: The content disposition of the raw email.

contentId.description: The content id of the raw email.

contentType.description: The content type of the raw email.

contentDisposition.description: The content disposition of the attachment.

contentId.description: The content id of the attachment.

contentType.description: The content type of the attachment.

contentUrl.description: The content uri of the attachment.

public_key.description: The raw credential public key bytes received from the attestation data.

clientDataJSON.description:
From the spec https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn/#dom-authenticatorresponse-clientdatajson
This attribute contains a JSON serialization of the client data passed to the authenticator
by the client in its call to either create() or get().

authenticatorAttachment.description:
AuthenticatorAttachment If this member is present, eligible authenticators are filtered to only
authenticators attached with the specified AuthenticatorAttachment enum.

requireResidentKey.description:
RequireResidentKey this member describes the Relying Party's requirements regarding resident
credentials. If the parameter is set to true, the authenticator MUST create a client-side-resident
public key credential source when creating a public key credential.

residentKey.description:
ResidentKey this member describes the Relying Party's requirements regarding resident
credentials per Webauthn Level 2.

userVerification.description:
UserVerification This member describes the Relying Party's requirements regarding user verification for
the create() operation. Eligible authenticators are filtered to only those capable of satisfying this
requirement.

new_keys_may_be_added_here.description: Chromium (Chrome) returns a hint sometimes about how to handle clientDataJSON in a safe manner.

type.description:
Type the string "webauthn.create" when creating new credentials,
and "webauthn.get" when getting an assertion from an existing credential. The
purpose of this member is to prevent certain types of signature confusion attacks
(where an attacker substitutes one legitimate signature for another).

id.description:
ID is The credentialâ€™s identifier. The requirements for the
identifier are distinct for each type of credential. It might
represent a username for username/password tuples, for example.

type.description:
Type is the value of the objectâ€™s interface object's [[type]] slot,
which specifies the credential type represented by this object.
This should be type "public-key" for Webauthn credentials.

id.description: CredentialID The ID of a credential to allow/disallow.

transports.description: The authenticator transports that can be used.

icon.description:
A serialized URL which resolves to an image associated with the entity. For example,
this could be a userâ€™s avatar or a Relying Party's logo. This URL MUST be an a priori
authenticated URL. Authenticators MUST accept and store a 128-byte minimum length for
an icon memberâ€™s value. Authenticators MAY ignore an icon memberâ€™s value if its length
is greater than 128 bytes. The URLâ€™s scheme MAY be "data" to avoid fetches of the URL,
at the cost of needing more storage.

Deprecated: this has been removed from the specification recommendations.

id.description: A unique identifier for the Relying Party entity, which sets the RP ID.

name.description:
A human-palatable name for the entity. Its function depends on what the PublicKeyCredentialEntity represents:

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity it is a human-palatable identifier for the Relying Party,
intended only for display. For example, "ACME Corporation", "Wonderful Widgets, Inc." or "ÐžÐÐž ÐŸÑ€Ð¸Ð¼ÐµÑ€Ñ‚ÐµÑ…".

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity, it is a human-palatable identifier for a user account. It is
intended only for display, i.e., aiding the user in determining the difference between user accounts with similar
displayNames. For example, "alexm", "alex.p.mueller@example.com" or "+14255551234".

displayName.description:
A human-palatable name for the user account, intended only for display.
For example, "Alex P. MÃ¼ller" or "ç”°ä¸­ å€«". The Relying Party SHOULD let
the user choose this, and SHOULD NOT restrict the choice more than necessary.

icon.description:
A serialized URL which resolves to an image associated with the entity. For example,
this could be a userâ€™s avatar or a Relying Party's logo. This URL MUST be an a priori
authenticated URL. Authenticators MUST accept and store a 128-byte minimum length for
an icon memberâ€™s value. Authenticators MAY ignore an icon memberâ€™s value if its length
is greater than 128 bytes. The URLâ€™s scheme MAY be "data" to avoid fetches of the URL,
at the cost of needing more storage.

Deprecated: this has been removed from the specification recommendations.

id.description:
ID is the user handle of the user account entity. To ensure secure operation,
authentication and authorization decisions MUST be made on the basis of this id
member, not the displayName nor name members. See Section 6.1 of
[RFC8266](https://www.w3.org/TR/webauthn/#biblio-rfc8266).

name.description:
A human-palatable name for the entity. Its function depends on what the PublicKeyCredentialEntity represents:

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity it is a human-palatable identifier for the Relying Party,
intended only for display. For example, "ACME Corporation", "Wonderful Widgets, Inc." or "ÐžÐÐž ÐŸÑ€Ð¸Ð¼ÐµÑ€Ñ‚ÐµÑ…".

When inherited by PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity, it is a human-palatable identifier for a user account. It is
intended only for display, i.e., aiding the user in determining the difference between user accounts with similar
displayNames. For example, "alexm", "alex.p.mueller@example.com" or "+14255551234".

attachments.description: attachments to the message                                                // MTP status message

body.description: the body attribute contains all the data and structure defined uniquely for the schema associated with the type attribute. It MUST be a JSON object conforming to RFC 7159                              // the encrypted message body

createdTime.description: time of message creation in UTC milliseconds since epoch

expiresTime.description: sender will abort the protocol if it doesn't get a response by this time (UTC milliseconds since epoch)

from.description: sender DID required because all mailio messages are encrypted

fromPrior.description: A DID is rotated by sending a message of any type to the recipient to be notified of the rotation

id.description: globally unique message identifier UUID (RFC 4122) recommended

intent.description: the intent of the message (if empty, ordinary message

plainBodyBase64.description: the plain text message body, base64 encoded (optional)

pthid.description: parent thread identifier. Uniquely identifies the parent thread that the message belongs to. If not included, the message is the first message in the thread.

thid.description: thread identifier. Uniquely identifies the thread that the message belongs to. If not included, the id property of the message MUST be treated as the value of the thid.

type.description: a valid message type URI (MUST be: application/didcomm-encrypted+json or application/didcomm-signed+json or application/mailio-smtp+json)

cborPayloadBase64.description: the payload that was signed, which is base64 encoded.

senderDomain.description: origin of the request (where DNS is published with Mailio public key)

signatureBase64.description: the signature of the payload, which is base64 encoded.

_rev.description:
Rev is the revision number returned
_Rev    string `json:"_rev,omitempty"`

supportsMailio.description: domain can be both (mailio and smtp)

supportsStandardEmail.description: domain can be both (mailio and smtp)

description.description: a human-readable description of the attachment (optional)

id.description: a globally unique identifier for the attachment

mediaType.description: the media type of the attachment

recipients.description: the recipients of the message (at least one)

tag.description: integrity check on the encrypted message

crv.description: The curve parameter used for the key

kty.description: Key Type, indicating the type of key used, such as an elliptic curve key ("OKP" for Octet Key Pair).

x.description: The X coordinate for the elliptic curve point

cborPayloadBase64.description: payload in cbor format of handshake Content

ownerAddress.description: mailio address of the owner of the handshake

ownerPublicKey.description: owner public key of the owner of the handshake

senderMetadata.description: sender meta data (either Mailio address or sha512 email address )

emailHash.description: scrypt hash of the email address

senderDomain.description: origin of the request (where DNS is published with Mailio public key)

epk.description: (Ephemeral Public Key): A temporary public key that was used in conjunction with the recipient's public key to encrypt the encrypted_key

kid.description: (Key ID): A hint indicating which key was used to encrypt the

ed25519SigningPublicKeyBase64.description: public key of the private key used to sign the nonce

databasePassword.description: this is a password for couchdbs private user database

ed25519SigningPublicKeyBase64.description: public key of the private key used to sign the nonce

address.description: Address of the recipient or sender

class.description: Represents the class of the status code (2, 4, 5)

detail.description: Represents the detail of the status code

subject.description: Represents the subject category of the status code

encrypted_key.description: Tthe key used to encrypt the ciphertext, encrypted with the recipient's public key

header.description: encryption parameters specific to each recipient

emailHash.description: scrypt hash of the email address

payload.description: The payload that was signed, which is base64URL encoded.

protected.description: Base64URL encoded JSON string containing the header parameters used for the signature

challengeSignature.description: signature of the challenge with the primary private key (held by client only)

passwordShare.description: a single share of a Shamir secret (2 out of 3 required for decryption)

primaryEd25519PublicKey.description: primary Ed25519 public key (associated with address)

primaryX25519PublicKey.description: primary X25519 public key (associated with address)
